dialogue.character_bard_default_event_01_p1: I go from settlement to settlement and play music. I will play at the inn tonight.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_02_p1: Music used to be everywhere. Now it is a kind of magic again.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_03_p1: Would you like to hear the story of Tem?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_03_p2: Tem was a gardener. When the Fall shut down his greenhouse, his colleagues fled, but he stayed.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_03_p3: He kept the plants alive through music. In the darkness, he grew amazing things.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_03_p4: One day, passing raiders tore it all down. They took Tem's Drum, and the last Greenhouse in the City died. Nobody knows what happened to Tem.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_04_p1: Would you like to hear the story of the Governor?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_04_p2: The Governor, as you know, ruled the City for decades before The Fall. Under his vision, many new levels were built in the City. He was well over 100 years old, and nodoby could imagine the City without him.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_04_p3: In his youth he fought for old Dictatorship against the rebels. He was one of the last soldiers to desert the Blue Army.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_04_p4: Nobody knows what happened to him during the Fall. Perhaps he is immortal, and will come back again?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_05_p1: Would you like to hear the story of Maren Eze?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_05_p2: Maren Eze was a fashion was an executive for Redflame, back then a luxury brand. In her orders, a waste storage facility was built in her native Sahel, outside of the City.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_05_p3: She knew the facility was not safe. But it looked very good on their marketing material, and much of the world outside the City was already turning into a wasteland.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_05_p4: Eze was able to evacuate most of her family from Sahel to the City, but most of the locals never had a chance.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_06_p1: Would you like to hear the story of Erxin?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_06_p2: Erxin grew up in the Slums, in District 47. But he had a talent for knockball, and rose to to omnurban wealth and fame.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_06_p3: To pay respects to his roots, he had a grand stadium built in District 47.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_06_p4: On the opening day of the stadium, there were so many people there to see their beloved Erxin, that the crowd turned into a crush and hundreds died. Erxin was never seen in public again.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_07_p1: Would you like to hear the story of Rudolf Grl?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_07_p2: Rudplf Grl was originally a Runner, a small time gangster hunting for valuables in the Dark Levels and selling them to the people on the Surface.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_07_p3: He founded his own little gang, called the Red Hats. This threatened the Hansa gang, and lead to a bloody war in the Slums.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_07_p4: Eventually, Grl among many others involved were imprisoned. But the rumour has it that he escaped, just a few months before The Fall.
dialogue.character_bard_default_meet_01_p1: People need more than just survival.
dialogue.character_bard_default_meet_02_p1: A bard is usually welcome in any settlement.
dialogue.character_bard_default_meet_03_p1: Oh, I've never met anyone who's been outside. Only heard legends.
dialogue.character_bard_default_meet_04_p1: I believe in magic. But I think people make it, not some magic spirits.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_01_p1: If you can find enough rubber you could make equipment to explore polluted areas.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_02_p1: You can never have too many hairpins.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_03_accep: Thank you. Hope these prove useful.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_03_p1: Would you like some crafting ingredients? I could trade some for supplies.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_04_p1: For a fee, I can improve your weapon.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_05_p1: For a fee, I can improve your equipment.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_meet_01_p1: I am looking for crafting ingredients.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_meet_02_p1: Fixing old things has become a valuable skill.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_meet_upgrade_c: Here you go. May it help you on your journey.
For a fee, I can improve a piece of your equipment.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_meet_upgrade_w: Here you go. May it help you on your journey.
For a fee, I can improve your weapon.
dialogue.character_darkDweller_default_interact_0: I am not used to being around so many people.
I believe the Fall was caused by us losing touch with nature.
Most old greenhouses are on the edges of the City, with access to sunlight.
Perhaps we can build a settlement on the Surface.
The old Government never held much sway in the Dark Levels anyway.
Humans built the City, but other creatures have made their home here too.
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_event_01_p1: We should never have left the Ground!
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_event_03_p1: The City will consume us all!
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_meet_01_p1: The City will claim us all! Repent!
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_meet_02_p1: This is the end! Humanity's time is ending!
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_meet_04_p1: We thought we can isolate ourselves from the cycle of life itself, but it was an illusion! Death returns with vengeance!
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_01_p1: Can I trade some of this junk for water?
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_02_p1: I have no use for this, you can have it.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_03_p1: I have not seen anyone of that description, but I'll kepe my eyes peeled for you and let you know if I see her.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_04_p1: I don't know if you just notice them more now that the lights are off, but it does feel like the earhquakes have been getting worse.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_05_p1: I think if you want to fix the Greenhouses, you need to find out what happened to Tem.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_06_p1: Before the Fall, all food and medicine was grown in the Greenhouses.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_01_p1: I make do with what I find out in the City.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_03_p1: Some levels are too polluted to live permanently on.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_04_p1: The City is hostile, but according to rumours the outside even more so.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_05_p1: It's easy to imagine seeing things when alone in the dark. You just need to focus on where you're going.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_06_p1: I hear things out in the City. Steps. Always behind me.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_block: There is some debris blocking the way to the {direction} of here.
There are some pretty unstable looking old explosives blocking the way to the {direction} of here.
There is an impassable gap to the {direction} of here.
There is a toll gate to the {direction} of here. What makes them think they can charge people for passage?
There is some industrial waste to the {direction} of here that blocks passage.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_campa: There is a safe sector for a camp to the {direction}.
If you're looking for a place to camp, go {direction}.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_hazar: The area {direction} of here is very cold.
There is an area full of debris {direction} of here. It's difficult to pass through.
There is a flooded area {direction} of here. It's not easy to pass through.
There is a polluted area {direction} of here. You'll need good equipment.
There is an area with radication {direction} of here. Be careful.
There is an area {direction} of here that is gang territory. I would be careful about going there.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_ingre: There's a good spot for scavenging ingredients not too far to the {direction} of here.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_settl: There is a settlement on this level called {name}.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_water: There is a {name} not far from here to the {direction}.
If you're looking for water, just go {direction}.
dialogue.character_generic_reserved_meet_02_p1: It's hard to keep track of time in the darkness.
dialogue.character_generic_story_explain_ground_0: I've heard that somewhere many levels down the City rests on the planet's surface.
How far down is the Ground? I have no idea.
Why do you want to find the Ground?
I wish I could leave the City too.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_alie: I heard that the Fall was an attack by aliens. They are probably settling on the Surface now.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_city: I fear the City itself has gone rogue and the Fall was just the beginning.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_gove: I think the Government caused the Fall. They were losing control and took as all down with them.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_hack: The Fall could have been caused by a group of hackers. They probably tried to take over the Network.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_hurr: I heard that hurricanes could cause destruction like The Fall. Perhaps it is safer to live closer to the Ground.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_spir: I think the Fall was a pressure wave created by the spirits of all those who died so the City could be built.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_terr: The Fall was a terrorist attack. I heard it from someone who was there.
dialogue.character_generic_story_government_cult_: The Governor will come back and save everyone.
dialogue.character_generic_story_government_neg2p: I used to think it was cool to criticize the Government but I miss it now. The old slums were much better than what we have now.
dialogue.character_generic_story_government_negat: The old Government was a dictatorship in disguise, and we're better off without it.
dialogue.character_generic_story_government_pos2n: I used to work for the Govenrment and thought it was the only thing keeping humanity together. But we're doing fine without it.
dialogue.character_generic_story_government_posit: The old Government built the best parts of the City and kept everything running.
dialogue.character_generic_story_searching_for_gr: Sorry, I haven't seen any Greenhouses.
I heard Greenhouses were often located on the edge of the City, where you have better access to sunlight.
dialogue.character_generic_story_warn_ground_01_p: I doubt it is possible to live outside the City.
dialogue.character_generic_story_warn_ground_02_p: I came to the City as a child as a refugee from the outside.
dialogue.character_generic_stranded_meet_directio: Thank you. I will go there and try to make myself useful.
Where is your settlement? Can I join you?
Oh. I understand. I will find another place.
dialogue.character_generic_stranded_meet_water_p1: I've ran out of water. Can you spare some?
Thank you, stranger. I am sure your good deed will come around.
The Fall has made wolves of us all.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_01_p1: Cockroaches are perfectly edible, but rats are tastier.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_02_p1: Watch out for the spiders, the grow big in the darkness.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_03_p1: Everything in the City is either flesh or blood, or machine. If it's flesh and blood, it can be killed.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_04_p1: I heard about the Surface Expedition. I hope they find out what happened.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_05_p1: I stopped thinking about the past and the future. In here there's just now.
dialogue.character_mercenary_default_meet_01_p1: Mercenary is a steady living in times like these.
dialogue.character_mercenary_default_meet_02_p1: I used to be a guard at a shopping mall.
dialogue.character_mercenary_default_meet_03_p1: People get superstitious in times like these. There are no ghosts or spirits here. For better or worse, it's just us humans.
dialogue.character_mercenary_default_meet_04_p1: The Red Hats were a gang associated with the Hansa. I didn't know they still existed though.
dialogue.character_messenger_default_meet_01_p1: I deliver messages from one settlement to another.
dialogue.character_messenger_default_meet_02_p1: There are secret passages between Levels but I will not tell you about them.
dialogue.character_messenger_default_meet_03_p1: Sectors closer to the middle of a district are generally safer.
dialogue.character_messenger_default_meet_04_p1: I heard of a settlement that was completely wiped out by disease.
dialogue.character_messenger_default_meet_05_p1: I hear the Surface Expedition took off. It was about fifteen people including the leader, Amanda Ettler. I don't think we heard back from them yet.
dialogue.character_scavenger_default_meet_01_p1: There is still treasure to be found in these corridors.
dialogue.character_scavenger_default_meet_02_p1: This looks like a good area for some scavenging.
dialogue.character_scavenger_default_meet_03_p1: You know how somtimes it becomes completely quiet for a few minutes or hours? The humming of the City just stops? Those are power outages.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_event_01_p1: There is a change going on the City. The Fall was just the beginning.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_event_02_p1: I heard you want to revive the Greenhouses.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_event_03_p1: If you want to revive the Greenhouses, you need help from the spirits.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_event_04_p1: I visited your temple, it was quite pleasant. I think you would like this.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_01_p1: Old magic survives and it will save us all.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_02_p1: These places have memories, and not all of them are friendly.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_03_p1: There are magical places and items left hidden in the dark corners of the City.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_04_p1: The Ground holds special power us all. It is the foundation of the City in more sense than one.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_05_p1: If you stay alone in the dark for awhile, and listen, you can hear the people who used to live here.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_blessing_p: If you want, I can cast a small protective spell on you.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_blessing_r: Very well, may your own determination guide you well.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_interact_0: I used to love the Dark Levels. I never thought I'd live here permanently though.
I heard the the Fall was caused by a meteorite.
We don't have to rebuild things the way they were, we can build something new.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_meet_01_p1: I am used to the darkness, but I can't get used to the quiet.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_meet_02_p1: I've come such a long way, I will make it out.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_meet_03_p1: Level 14 is almost impassable. It was bad already before the Fall but some containment seems to have failed since then.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_meet_04_p1: How long has it been since The Fall? Weeks? Years? I've completely lost my sense of time.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_meet_05_p1: First we lost power. The the refugees came. We ran out of food. I became a refugee too.
dialogue.character_surfaceRefugee_default_interac: Together we can rebuild and rise again.
They say The Fall was a big explosion. I wonder what happened.
I want to know what really caused The Fall.
Will everything ever go back to normal again?
I wonder what happened to the Governor.
I heard there is a huge crater on the Surface.
The Sundome was destroyed in the Fall. It's dangerous on the Surface now.
I feel like the world before the Fall is so far away, like a dream.
dialogue.character_surfaceRefugee_default_meet_01: My parents are still near the Surface.
dialogue.character_surfaceRefugee_default_meet_02: I am not sure where I'm going.
dialogue.character_surfaceRefugee_default_meet_03: I don't know what happened, but the Surface is completely destroyed.
dialogue.character_surfaceRefugee_default_meet_04: I am disappointed in the Government. This all happened, and they just.. disappeared.
dialogue.character_trader_default_meet_02_p1: Travelling these parts is risky, but the trade is worth it.
dialogue.character_workerApothecary_default_inter: Medicine decreases the chance of disease outbreaks
Old supplies of medicine are fast running out
I don't know what you found there on the Ground, but I am glad we're able to make our own medicine.
dialogue.character_workerChemist_default_interact: Together we can defeat the Fall and rise again.
We are going to need lots of fuel.
dialogue.character_workerCleric_default_interact_: We must find a balance between technology and nature.
My most important duty is the serve the community.
The spirits lead us to build a stronger community.
dialogue.character_workerConcrete_default_interac: Rebuilding will take a lot of materials.
The City is mostly made of concrete.
The City was built over decades.
dialogue.character_workerGardener_default_interac: Growing anything in the City is a delicate process.
Before the Fall, agriculture relied on near infinite energy and artificial light.
Plants are not machines. They know if you care about them.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_default_interact: There is much we don't know about the City.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_01_p1: Rumours are vital for figuring out what is going on in the City now that mass communication is dead.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_02_p1: Evidence is knowledge and technology from before. We should save and store it.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_apocaly: I wonder if it would be safer to leave the City before the earthquakes destroy it?
I have faith in us finding a way to survive the earthquakes.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_searchi: Perhaps if we find a Greenhouse, we can make medicine and stop these disease outbreaks.
I'm worried because we don't have access to medicine.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_spirits: I was not religious before, but I am glad we built the shrine.
I don't know if I belive in the spirits.
The Greenhouses are all the proof I need that the spirits are real.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_story_g: I feel much safer now that we can grow herbs in the Greenhouses.
We have to find a way to restore the Greenhouses.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_meet_02_p1: Good to see a familiar face out here.
dialogue.character_workerRobotmaker_default_inter: I wonder what happened to my family and friends on the Surface.
Robots used to be much more complex, but we have to start somewhere.
dialogue.character_workerRope_default_interact_01: Textiles have always driven human progress.
dialogue.character_workerRope_default_interact_02: In retrospect, clothes used to be really weird.
dialogue.character_workerRubber_default_interact_: We're lucky we found such a good source of rubber.
I used to work in the mines.
dialogue.character_workerScavenger_default_intera: We are lucky to be alive.
The City will provide us with supplies for decades to come.
Metal is our main building material. We are going to need lots of it.
You can use scrap metal to craft and build all kinds of things.
You can often find specific spots in the City for scavenging crafting ingredients.
dialogue.character_workerScavenger_default_meet_0: I'm out to collect building materials for the camp.
This place is a near infinite source of scap metal.
dialogue.character_workerScientist_default_intera: I am worried about the earthquakes.
We should re-learn as much as possible from the old technologies before the knowledge and remains disappear.
We are figuring out how things we used to take for granted really worked.
I dream of finding a library one day.. but I fear most of our lost knowledge was saved in electronic formats.
I had no idea the earthquakes were this bad. The old Government really dropped the ball on this.
We are trying to figure out if there is some way to reinforce the city or stop the earthquakes, but I am not optimistic.
I don't think life outside the City is possible at this point.
I don't believe in the spirits, but if believing in them makes people happier then that's good.
dialogue.character_workerSoldier_default_interact: There's a lot of hungry people out there that are jealous of everything we have.
I am prepared to defend this community with my life.
First robbers and now ghosts? What are we supposed to do about that?
dialogue.character_workerToolsmith_default_intera: It is satisfying to make useful things with your own hands.
dialogue.character_workerTrapper_default_interact: I never knew there was so much wildlife in the City. Were they all there before the Fall?
I didn't use to think much about where my food came from.
If we run out of food, people will leave.
dialogue.character_workerTrapper_default_meet_01_: I'm out to check the traps.
dialogue.character_workerTrapper_default_meet_02_: Out to collect food for the camp.
dialogue.character_workerWater_default_interact_0: We're lucky the City still collects and filters water.
We throw away any water that tastes or smells funny.
We need food and water in the camp and for expeditions.
dialogue.character_workerWater_default_meet_01_p1: Out to collect water for the camp.
dialogue.character_workerWater_default_meet_02_p1: I'm out to inspect the water collectors.
dialogue.explorer_generic_animal_event_01_p1: The animal stands patiently outside the camp. It looks hungry.
dialogue.explorer_generic_dog_interact_03_p1: The dog looks ready for another adventure.
dialogue.explorer_generic_dog_interact_04_p1: The dog gives out a happy bark.
dialogue.explorer_generic_dog_interact_05_p1: The dog gives your hand a lick.
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_story_apocalyp: Where can we go if the City is not safe?
I have nightmares about the whole City collapsing due to the earthquakes.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_event_01_p1: It's not safe to wander around alone here
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_01_p: Seen some strange creatures out there.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_02_p: Do you think there's anyone left alive outside the City?
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_03_p: I don't miss the past. Now everyone is the architect of their own fortune.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_04_p: Do you think the rumours are true? That there are ghosts in the Dark Levels.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_05_p: I did what I had to do to survive after the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_06_p: I'm not surprised if some of the old Slum gangs survived The Fall.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_meet_01_p1: Do you actually know how to use that weapon?
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_event_01_p1: I'm pretty good at finding the good stuff.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_01_p: Canned food will stay good for another several decades.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_02_p: Sometimes scavenging in these levels feels more like archeology.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_03_p: I'm lucky that I'm in good health.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_04_p: If the City runs out of emergency power, I wonder if it will get cold here in the City.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_05_p: These levels were mostly abandoned long before the Fall. Why did we keep building new ones?
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_06_p: I don't feel bad about taking dead people's stuff.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_meet_01_p1: Good meeting another human being out here.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_event_01_p1: I can help you find passage through the City.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_01_p1: I'm so used to the darkness now, I can't imagine what the City would look with the lights on.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_02_p1: I hope to see the Ground one day.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_03_p1: I used to run odd jobs for the Black Societies but I after the Fall I just left.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_04_p1: You have to be careful when out in the City. It's easy to get hurt in the rubble.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_05_p1: Exploring the Dark Levels is like unearthing the history of the City one level at a time.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_06_p1: It's a strange place we call home, the City.
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_find_greenhouse_p: If we want the camp to succeed, we need to find medicine.
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_rescue_prospector: We can't just leave Sunita wandering alone out there. We should go find her. She can't have gotten far.
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_searching_for_gre: We should look for a Greenhouse out in the City.
The only way to stop the disease outbreaks in the camps is to find a way to produce medicine.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_event_01_p1: Hello there. I believe I'm lost, could I stay here for awhile?
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_01_p: The darkness is a terrible place to be alone.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_02_p: I.. don't really remember how I got here. I don't remember the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_03_p: I will make myself useful here in any way I can.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_04_p: Something must have happened to me during or after the Fall that made me lose my memory.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_05_p: I think I lived near the Surface. I remember the sun. The Governor on a screen. But I'm not sure who I was or what I did.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_06_p: It's terrifing being alone in the City, not even sure who you are. You become some kind of an animal.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_07_p: Perhaps I worked with weapons before the Fall? I seem to be quite good at using them.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_08_p: I will protect this community with my life and I expect others to do the same.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_09_p: I remember the Government as a kind of stability and direction.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_10_p: Those who try to rob innocent people out in the City don't deserve your pity.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_11_p: The darkness, if you're in it long enough it's like it's alive. I don't know if the City or some separate entity but.. it feels hostile.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_12_p: I recognized a gang marking the other day. Nobody else here seems to know about it. The Runners. They mostly smuggled things from the Dark Levels.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_event_01_p1: I can generally find my way around the City.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_01_: I'm confident we will build something better this time.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_02_: I used to be an architect. It is strange now to wander here and see all these buildings for myself.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_03_: I think the Government did their best but they had some outdated ideas about City planning.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_04_: Nobody ever considered how transportation between levels would work if the elevators stopped working.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_05_: Do you think we will ever definitely know what caused The Fall?
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_06_: I'm glad people are starting to plan where they build things in the camps a bit.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_07_: Architecture says a lot about the people who built it.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_08_: The first builders of the City were utopists. But then the Dictatorship took over and we got all those bare concrete levels.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_09_: Middle levels of the City have different heights. During the City States period everything was a bit chaotic.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_10_: We will find a way up to the Surface, and find out what happened.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_11_: I cannot believe the Government was ready to abandon its people like this.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_12_: I am sad to have to leave the City. For all its faults, it is a magnificant achievement.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_meet_01_p1: Well met. Do you have any water by any chance?
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_event_01_p1: Perhaps you are looking for some help?
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_01_p1: There are so many stories hidden out there in the City, waiting to be discovered.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_02_p1: I love going to abadoned homes and imagining what the people who used to live there were like.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_03_p1: Humans were made to dance and sing and paint and tell stories like beavers were made to build dams.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_04_p1: Sure magic exists. How else would we have built this monster? How else would we even live?
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_05_p1: I was always against the Government. They restricted individual freedoms too much and they had no imagination.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_06_p1: I grew up in the Slums. It was as good place as any, really.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_07_p1: Rituals are stronger to more times you repeat them. People in the Dark Levels hold on to old magic, and it can be very real.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_08_p1: The two most powerful forces in the universe are habits, and imagination.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_09_p1: We are kind of rootless here in the City. We were made to live on the Ground.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_10_p1: We could live a long time like this, just scavenging on the stuff left behind by a society long gone.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_11_p1: I think the Government relied on some magic too. It just pretended it was science.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_12_p1: I hope as we grow this tribe remains like this, where every individual is free and respected.
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_event_01_p: I heard you are looking for scavengers.
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_interact_0: The City is larger than you can imagine.
The Government thought it ran the City, but it only ran the Surface.
There is old magic on the Ground. I can help you find the way.
In a situation like this, everyone must contribute. Nature suffers no freeloaders.
I have lived by scavening all my life.
It's not power that the Greenhouses need, it's faith.
The spirits will guide you, and you will reinvigorate the City.
History is right hear, all around us. We just need to learn to read.
Shall we go explore some more?
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_interact_1: The City is holy because so many people believed in it. We must keep believing.
This plan to evacuate was doomed to fail.
Where ever we go, the spirits will follow.
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_meet_01_p1: I heard you are looking for scavengers.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_event_01_p1: I've worked as a guard since before the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_01_p1: The City feels different now. But it's still keeping us all alive.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_02_p1: I worked as a guard at Giga, the mining corporation.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_03_p1: Some people turned into robbers and looters as soon as the Network went down.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_04_p1: I lived periodically in the Dark Levels before the Fall. But it was just inside Giga facilities. I had no idea there was so much abandoned stuff.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_05_p1: The City was built by miners, not governments.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_06_p1: I lived alone, so I only miss my mates at Giga. When you work in a mine together, you become a close-knit group.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_07_p1: We have to stick together in times like this.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_08_p1: Survival of the fittest is never as simple as you think. There's always some luck involved.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_09_p1: These robbers make me angry. Plenty of stuff to scavenge, no need to attack people.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_10_p1: The Government only cared about the Surfacers.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_11_p1: I do miss my old life. But it is what it is.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_12_p1: I did sometimes wonder why the Government wasn't interested in space technology.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_meet_01_p1: Do you have use for a guard?
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_story_expedition: Well I'm glad I didn't join the Surface Expedition after all.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_story_rescue_abs: I hope Sunita knows what she's doing.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_event_01_p1: Sometimes there's an easier way through if you know how old locks work.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_01_p1: Old keycards still work most of the time. And if you know how, you can make fake ones. Helps opening all kinds of doors.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_02_p1: Even with the Network down, the City keeps some critical infrastructure running. And some of it can be hacked.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_03_p1: I used to spend almost all of my time online.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_04_p1: I'm glad the Government is gone, but who is going to maintain the City in the long run? We need to rebuild before it's too late.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_05_p1: I don't know why you would want to leave the City.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_06_p1: I've been learning lock-picking. In the lower levels there's all kinds of old models.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_07_p1: I think the Fall could have been caused by a cyber-attack. I knew people who wanted to bring down the Government at any cost.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_08_p1: I think we could get the Network back online before long. It would be amazing to have that without all the Government cencorship.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_09_p1: I think there's a perfectly rational explanation for the so called spirits, we just don't know it.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_10_p1: The Governor was a tyrant but nobody was allowed to criticise him in public.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_11_p1: Old drones are really resilient. They might activate even when you least expect it.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_12_p1: I always dreamed of going to space.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_meet_01_p1: Sometimes there's an easier way through if you know how old locks work.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_01_p1: I grew up on the Surface, worked in an office. After the Fall I just somehow learned to survive.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_02_p1: I was looking for some place to just start over.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_03_p1: I will fight by your side as long as you will have me.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_04_p1: I survived the Fall together with my fiance. I thought we would escape together. But she betrayed me the first chance she got.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_05_p1: Sometimes, I wish this was all just a dream. It feels like a dream. One long, endless night..
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_06_p1: I think this community has what it takes.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_07_p1: I didn't think about the Government much. I was just living my life, minding my own business.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_08_p1: I was on the Surface when the Fall happened. But I was asleep. I woke up and it was just complete chaos. The Sundome was down. A garbage bot guided us to a bunker.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_09_p1: We will traverse the entire City if we need to to find out what happened.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_10_p1: Do you think you could be the next Governor one day?
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_11_p1: I am not sure if I want to see the Surface again. In ruins.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_12_p1: The destruction up here is worse than I realised. I don't think I could find whatever's left of my home.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_event_01_p1: I am looking for a place to stay.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_01: I used to work for Futurefields, but I was a researcher rather than farmer.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_02: After the Fall, I decided to just leave the City.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_03: I would like to follow along with you and find out what there is outside of the City.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_04: I survived the Fall just because I happened to be in the lab.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_05: There is an astonishing variety of flora and fauna even in the Dark Levels of the City. The City truly is its own ecosystem.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_06: I wonder if these polluted areas in the City happened before or after the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_07: There were these rituals at Futurefields, related to seed storage and harvest and so on. Of course they were called procedures or something. But they were rituals.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_08: The Ground was even more megical than I ever imagined. It is a shame we never got to see the outside.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_09: Humans are just one animal living in the City.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_10: I think the Government was too focused on technological progress, and somehow lost contact with nature.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_11: I still have nightmares about The Fall.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_12: I had no idea the whole planet was in danger.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_meet_01_p1: I am looking for a place to stay.
dialogue.explorer_template_servo_interact_03_p1: Today is the first of N9, year 783. It is the first day of Bustle.
dialogue.explorer_template_servo_interact_04_p1: I am currently not able to connect to the Network for weather information.
dialogue.explorer_template_servo_interact_05_p1: I will see to it immediately.
dialogue.explorer_template_servo_interact_06_p1: I hope you have a wonderful day.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_event_01_p1: I'm alone, can I please stay here?
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_01_p1: I don't know what happened to my family.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_02_p1: It's amazing what you can find if you look.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_03_p1: I'm so happy I found a place to stay. It was scary to go alone.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_04_p1: I never knew there were so many Levels.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_06_p1: I know it wasn't pretty after the Fall. I just.. ran away I guess.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_07_p1: One time I found this action figurine of an old series I from the 60s that I like for some reason. It's my lucky charm.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_09_p1: Do you think the earthquakes are getting worse?
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_10_p1: I think someone should build an amusement park. It would be a huge success.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_11_p1: Thanks for taking me with you.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_12_p1: I'm not scared. I know we can figure this out. We figured everything else out.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_event_01_p1: You look like someone who could use a bodyguard.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_01_p1: Everyone is just trying to get by the best they can.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_03_p1: Before the Fall? Oh, I did some odd jobs. All over the place, really.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_04_p1: I don't like being alone in the Dark Levels. I keep seeing things there in the shadows.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_05_p1: It was not possible to not be associated with a gang where I grew up.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_06_p1: I think some people still run with the old gangs, but the structure fell apart pretty quickly after The Fall.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_07_p1: I know ghosts exist. I've seen them. Down here, in the darkness.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_08_p1: After the Fall, it all just seemed so pointless. I just kind of left.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_09_p1: There's some really beautiful places in the City you know. I thought it was just a place, but I think it has a personality of its own.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_10_p1: I want to believe there's a meaning to this all.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_11_p1: I'm just a guy, but I feel like I can help a greater purpose here.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_12_p1: I don't know why I heard the spirits. Maybe they just called out to someone.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_meet_01_p1: You look like someone who needs use a bodyguard.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_story_find_green: I think if we found a Greenhouse we could make our own medicine. We should search for one.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_story_find_spiri: I know this is going to sound weird.. But I keep hearing these voices. Thye're friendly. Encouraging.
They're clearer now, close to the ground. I think they are trying to lead me somewhere. Can we try to follow?
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_story_gangs_comp: Red Hats? Oh, so this is where they were. Their leader escaped from prison maybe a year before the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_story_search_spi: Let's get back on the Ground.
It's not clear but.. I think we should head {direction}
It sounds like they are somewhere {direction} of here
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_story_spirits_in: Do you ever hear voices that seem to be calling from somewhere deep in the City?
Sometimes I think I'm imagining things. Sometimes, I think there's something out there, trying to talk to me. Us.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_story_spirits_ou: That grove was magical. I mean. I feel like.. I feel humbled, but happy at the same time.
Ever since we visited that grove, I feel like I'm a tiny part of something bigger. Something ancient, and holy.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_01_p1: I've lived in the Dark Levels my whole life.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_02_p1: There used to be very few people in the Dark Levels. Ha! Not it's starting to feel almost crowded, you know.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_03_p1: They say there are ten bats to every human here in the dark levels. But they are very good at staying out of sight!
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_04_p1: The Ground is a beautiful, magical, wild place.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_05_p1: Your Government left people down here alone and we left you alone.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_06_p1: Look, it's just my opinion, but I think you'd be better off staying here in the City.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_07_p1: Bats are excellent messengers. But you have to treat them with respect! They owe you nothing.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_08_p1: I believe magic comes from us, people, and the things we put value in. Rituals work because we believe in them.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_09_p1: I hope your Government didn't doom us all with whatever they did up there.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_10_p1: Some of my people would consider me a traitor for joining up with you. But I say strange times call for strange measures.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_11_p1: Nothing quite like a good cup of strong coffee before heading out.
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_interact_12_p1: I never knew what I signed up when I joined you, but I'm very glad I did!
dialogue.explorer_unique_handler_story_rescue_abs: Sunita will be alright. She knows how to take care of herself.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_event_01_p1: I would be delighted to join you.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_01_p1: I have spent years alone in the Dark Levels, seeking for Truth in meditation. But I now believe you cannot find it alone.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_02_p1: I am curious about what caused the Fall. But I suspect ultimately it was divine intervention. Signal for us to do better.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_03_p1: I am grateful that you have accepted me to your community.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_04_p1: The Governor preached human progress, but no real progress was made. We became complacent.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_05_p1: This tribe can become a fresh start for humanity.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_06_p1: Did you know that back in the City States period, Etrurians had their own little state? I would like to see the ruins one day.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_07_p1: I never saw any ghosts or spirits in my years in the Dark Levels. But that doesn't mean they don't exist.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_08_p1: According to the teachings of my religion, this planet was created for humans to govern. But perhaps we did not govern it well.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_09_p1: Members of my church often spent some time in the Dark Levels, as charity. But I stayed longer than most.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_10_p1: I sometimes get nervous around this many people, but it makes me glad to see this tribe prosper.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_11_p1: I believe God is watching very closely what we are doing here. This might be our last chance to save humanity.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_interact_12_p1: I believe these spirits are but a facet of God.
dialogue.explorer_unique_hermit_meet_01_p1: I would be delighted to join you.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_event_01_p1: I have been wandering on my own for too long.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_01_p: I used to be a journalist. Now I'm just someone who can't let a story go.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_02_p: I want to know what caused the Fall. I think it's related to a story I was investigating before.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_03_p: I would like to tag along when you go exploring.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_04_p: I wonder if any of my colleagues from the magazine are still alive, out there somewhere.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_05_p: It's important to collect and preserve what evidence we can about the Fall while it's still fresh.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_06_p: I want to bring whoever is responsible for the Fall to justice. Even if they're long dead - history needs to know.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_07_p: I'm glad we met. You're a good person.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_08_p: There's so much information lost because the Network is down. We have to investigate the old fashioned way.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_09_p: Where did you grow up? I am from District 24.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_10_p: I was in prison on Level 5 when the Fall happened. It was pretty chaotic afterwards.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_11_p: I was imprisoned for poking around Government facilities. It made me even more curious about what they were up to.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_12_p: After I escaped the prison, I swore to find out what caused The Fall.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_interact_13_p: Isn't it strange that all higher Government officials seem to have disappeared in the Fall?
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_meet_01_p1: I have been wandering on my own for too long.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_story_debris_: So they launched the spacecraft, but something went horribly wrong. They must have known they were taking an incredible risk.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_story_evacuat: So the Government knew about the earthquakes and spacecraft was for evacuation.
I can't believe they were ready to just abandon the majority of their people and run away.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_story_spacecr: We know the Government was building a spacecraft, even though publicly they were not interested in space exploration. Why?
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_story_start_p: Do you have a moment? I want to ask you something.
Before the Fall, I was a journalist. I was investigating rumours of secret facilities run by the Government in the Dark Levels.
It's not clear exactly what they were, but I know they existed. I had documents indicating their locations, but I lost them.
I'm convinced it's all connected to the Fall. Can you help me try and find those facilities?
Thank you. All these survivors, they deserve to know what really happened.
dialogue.explorer_unique_journalist_story_storeho: We have proof that the Government was preparing for something. I knew it. They knew something was coming. And they kept it secret. Why?
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_event_01_p1: I need a safe place to rest, can I come with you?
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_01_p: I lived in the Sundome but happened to be near the Ground when the Fall happened, and now I'm stuck here.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_02_p: The City is over a hundred years old, but originally it was just a few levels.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_03_p: The City is a mess right now, but it will get better. I can guarantee you that the outside is worse.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_04_p: We used lifts to commute between the research station and our homes. But they stopped working because of the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_05_p: I can't stop thinking about my sister. I'm sure she's still alive there somewhere.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_06_p: My sister is a dreamer. She wanted to become a model.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_07_p: It must have been chaotic near the Surface after the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_08_p: Do you ever wonder what happened to all the people you used to know?
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_09_p: I had this colleague, a researcher. She was pretty secretive about here work. I have a feeling I know what it was about now.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_10_p: I will never forgive my boss who stole supplies from me and my colleagues right after The Fall.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_11_p: Family has always been important to me.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_interact_12_p: In a way, you were right all along. We need to find a way out of this City.
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_meet_01_p1: I need a safe place to rest, can I come with you?
dialogue.explorer_unique_prospector_story_rescue_: I never thought I'd see you again.
Nisha seems to be happy here.
I wonder if my sister is still alive. She's not exactly a survivalist..
I know everyone has lost loved ones. But my sister.. I was supposed to be there with her.
I worry about my sister, Nisha. She is somewhere near the Surface. I wish I could go find her.
Listen, I can't sit around and wait anymore. I'm going to find my sister.
This place is eerie. Let's see if we can find a way further up.
I wish there was some way to get through Level 14.
Let's look for better equipment, maybe we can find away to explore Level 14.
I want to go to Level 14. Please. If there is a way to the Surface, I need to know.
Let's go scout Level 14. If there is a way further up, maybe I can go find my sister.
dialogue.locale_generic_bunker_intro_p1: A bunker left over from wars long gone.
dialogue.locale_generic_farm_intro_p1: This is where the City's foods used to be produced.
dialogue.locale_generic_grocery_intro_p1: You are not the first one to loot this place but perhaps there is still something useful left.
dialogue.locale_generic_house_intro_p1: A house looks accessible from the street.
dialogue.locale_generic_hut_intro_p1: You knock on the door, but there is no answer.
dialogue.locale_generic_lab_intro_p1: Some kind of a laboratory was located here.
dialogue.locale_generic_library_intro_p1: You decide to check out the {name}.
dialogue.locale_generic_maintenance_intro_p1: You spot an entrance to a {name}.
dialogue.locale_generic_market_intro_p1: A {name} looks like a good place for finding something useful.
dialogue.locale_generic_obstacle_claustrophobia_p: You find yourself in a long and narrow corridor and being to feel trapped.
dialogue.locale_generic_obstacle_door_p1: The door is jammed, but perhaps you can get in through the broken window.
dialogue.locale_generic_obstacle_draft_p1: The draft slams a door shut.
dialogue.locale_generic_obstacle_pillar_p1: A fallen pillar blocks the way
dialogue.locale_generic_obstacle_remains_p1: You spot human remains. Someone tried to camp here after the Fall, but didn't make it.
dialogue.locale_generic_obstacle_spoiled_p1: The shelves are full of things, but they are mostly useless, or spoiled.
dialogue.locale_generic_obstacle_stair_p1: A stair breaks under your foot, but you catch the railing.
dialogue.locale_generic_office_intro_p1: A large office building looms over the street.
dialogue.locale_generic_restaurant_intro_p1: You walk in through the main door.
dialogue.locale_generic_sewer_intro_p1: The sewer is damp and unwelcoming.
dialogue.locale_generic_store_intro_p1: A {name} beckons at the edge of the corridor.
dialogue.locale_generic_warehouse_intro_p1: And old warehouse. There must be something worth taking here.
dialogue.locale_workshop_fuel_intro_p1: A fuel refinery stands hollow and quiet.
dialogue.locale_workshop_fuel_outro_p1_meta: Workers on level {campLevel} can now be assigned to work here.
dialogue.locale_workshop_rubber_intro_p1: A rubber plantation stands withered and silent.
dialogue.locale_workshop_rubber_outro_p1: The plantation is ready to be used again.
dialogue.locale_workshop_rubber_outro_p1_meta: Workers on level {campLevel} can now be assigned to work here.
dialogue.refugees_default_event_01_p1: We had a little settlement but it was destroyed. There's {num} of us left, can we stay here?
dialogue.refugees_default_event_01_accept: Thank you! We will do our best.
dialogue.refugees_default_event_01_reject: Then we'll be on our way.
dialogue.refugees_default_event_02_p1: The City is unpredictable and dangerous. Could we stay here? We are {num} people, everyone can work.
dialogue.refugees_default_event_02_accept: Thank you! You will not regret this.
dialogue.refugees_default_event_02_reject: Very well, we will look elsewhere.
dialogue.refugees_default_event_03_p1: We have nowhere else to go. We are only {num} people. Can we stay here?
dialogue.refugees_default_event_03_reject: I don't know how we will survive.
dialogue.refugees_earthquake_event_01_p1: Our camp was destroyed in an earthquake.
dialogue.refugees_earthquake_event_01_accpet: Our camp was destroyed in an earthquake.
dialogue.refugees_earthquake_event_01_reject: Our camp was destroyed in an earthquake.
dialogue.visitor_unique_expedition_01_p1: Amanda Ettler is organizing a big expedition to the Surface to find out what happened. I'm travelling to join it.

messages.explorer_level_up_message_01: {Name} found better equipment and improved their ability
messages.passage_found_elevator_message: There used to be an elevator here.
messages.passage_found_hole_down_dark_message: There is a massive sinkhole here. Only vast emptiness is visible below.
messages.passage_found_hole_down_sunlit_message: There is a massive sinkhole here. A street is visible far, far below.
messages.passage_found_hole_up_dark_message: Far above in the ceiling there is a hole, a mouth leading into blackness.
messages.passage_found_hole_up_sunlit_message: Far above in the ceiling there is a hole leading to the level above.
messages.passage_found_prebuilt_message: There is a maintenance staircase here that is in good repair.
messages.passage_found_stairwell_message: There used to be a staircase here.

sector_descriptions._example_01: [A] [narrow] [street] between two [monolithic] [huts]. Both water and food can be collected here. There is a camp here.
sector_descriptions._example_02: [A] [narrow] [street] between two [monolithic] [huts]. Both water and food can be collected here. There is a camp here.

sector_status._enemies_message: There are some hostile creatures here. Scavenging is more risky.

sequences.locale_generic_clinic_intro: A haphazard clinic set up by a doctor who is defying the post-Fall chaos by helping whoever needs it.
sequences.locale_generic_clinic_treatment: The doctor cleans and bandages your wouds briskly and urges you to stay out of trouble.

stories.escape_camp_start_message: Here is good enough to rest and heal.
stories.escape_exploring_start_message: The City is endless. It continues forward and backward, up and down, layer after layer. Separated by concrete and metal, are other corridors, other buildings, tunnels, towers.
stories.escape_get_up_message: It takes awhile for you to make out your surroundings.
stories.escape_healed_start_message: Finally ready to travel again. The only a way out of this crumbling maze is downwards.
stories.escape_launch_message: And so finally you leave the City behind.
stories.escape_passage_found_message: You find a gaping hole in the level floor. Upon closer examination, it used to be a staircase. Probably some kind of an emergency exit. Unfortunately, it requires repairs.
stories.escape_passage_found_message_2: Perhaps the people at the camp would help repair this staircase.
stories.escape_passage_repaired_message: Finally, the way forward is open. If there is an exit, it will be somewhere below.
stories.escape_passage_search_start_message: You have to find some way to the level below.
stories.escape_passage_used_message: One level down, one step closer to escaping this place.
stories.escape_start_message: You are alone in a massive dark corridor, far below sunlight.
stories.expedition_diary_p1: The first pages of the diary describe in detail careful preparations and theories of what the expedition might find.
stories.expedition_diary_p2: The expedition begins well, with the group finding their way to the surface easier than expected, and most of them tolerating the elements well, although some turn back at this point.
stories.expedition_diary_p3: The remaining group notices that not far from the epicenter of desctruction, in an area that in old maps is dedicated to agriculture, there are remains of a huge closed off facility.
stories.expedition_diary_p4: Upon investigating, they are suddenly attacked by guard drones, somehow still powered. They are completely taken by surprise, one killed immediately and many badly injured. Those well enough go out to seek help whereas the wounded stay behind in a makeshift camp.
stories.expedition_locale_camp_p1: The camp is very hastily set up, just a couple of lean-tos to keep the wind and the sun out.
stories.expedition_locale_camp_p2: You quickly find the remains of several people. They seem to have been badly wounded.
stories.expedition_locale_camp_p3: Name tags on their clothing confirm that they were members of the Surface Expedition.
stories.fall_found_preparations_message: Did the old Government know about the Fall beforehand?
stories.fall_locale_depot_p1: A huge and orderly storeroom, shelf after shelf carefully labelled, all empty.
stories.fall_locale_depot_p2: It doesn't look scavenged, but systemically cleared and abandoned. Someone stored huge amounts of supplies here and then took them.
stories.fall_locale_spacefactory_p1: The facility is behind tight security, and it takes awhile for you to find a safe way in.
stories.fall_locale_spacefactory_p2: At first it seems like an ordinary manufacturing plant. You realise it was used to build a flying vessel. A spacecraft?
stories.gangs_locale_compound_p1: It takes some time to get through the thick walls and locked doors of the compound.
stories.gangs_locale_compound_p2: Inside, you find some kind of a lavish hideout with quarters for several dozen people, and a luxury apartment for what must have been their leader. They called themselves 'The Red Hats'.
stories.gangs_locale_compound_p3: It seems like The Fall cut them off water, so they abandoned the place. They left behind, food, weapons, and piles of now worthless paper money.
stories.greenhouse_disease_started_message: The disease is spreading. We need to find medicine.
stories.greenhouse_greenhouse_found_message: We must continue searching. Perhaps some plands have surived on the Ground?
stories.greenhouse_locale_story_greenhouse_p1: The Greenhouse is dull and lifeless. Dead leaves of different shapes hint at the variety of plants that somehow, impossibly, grew here not so long ago.
stories.greenhouse_locale_story_seeddepot_p1: A modern facility with Futurefields logos all over. Looks like a seed back of some sort?
stories.greenhouse_locale_story_seeddepot_p2: Something has gone wrong here. All the seeds seem lifeless, even though the backup generator is working. This will not help us restart the Greenhouses.
stories.locale_story_shelter_p1: At first the apartment appears abandoned. But you notice someone has been clearing junk and cooking here.
stories.locale_story_shelter_p2: In the back room you find Sunita and her sister, very hungry but otherwise safe. They are very happy to see you.
stories.tribe_crisis_message: What if it's true, and there's nothing outside the City?
stories.tribe_first_worker_message: The newcomer is weary but unafraid. They say they want to build a home here.
stories.tribe_growing_message: Some people are starting to call this place not just "camp", but "home".
stories.tribe_not_alone_message: You are not alone here on this level. There are footsteps in the dust, burned out torches. Perhaps someone else is looking for a place to rest too?

actions.use_campfire_failed_message: Sat at the campfire to exchange stories, but there was nothing new.
actions.use_campfire_message: Sat at the campfire to exchange stories about the corridors.
actions.use_in_market_completed_message: Visited the market and listened to the latest gossip.

camp.events_none_description: All is quiet in the camp.
camp.last_raid_lost_no_resources_message: Camp attacked, nothing left to steal.
camp.raid_danger_description: Risk that a raid against the camp is successful.

embark.page_description: Make sure you pack enough supplies before you leave.
embark.warning_low_food_description: There won't be much food left in the camp.
embark.warning_low_stamina_description: Won't get far with low stamina.
embark.warning_low_supplies_description: Won't get far without food and water.
embark.warning_low_water_description: There won't be much water left in the camp.

exploration.sector_status_no_enemies_description: There doesn't seem to be anything hostile around.
exploration.sector_status_not_scouted_description: You have not scouted this sector yet.
exploration.sector_status_passage_elevator_built_des: There is an <style='highlight'>elevator</style> here, and it has been repaired.
exploration.sector_status_passage_elevator_default_d: There is an <style='highlight'>elevator</style> here, but it is broken.
exploration.sector_status_passage_hole_built_descrip: There is a newly built <style='highlight'>elevator</style> going {direction} here.
exploration.sector_status_passage_hole_down_default_: There is a <style='highlight'>hole</style> in the level ceiling here.
exploration.sector_status_passage_hole_up_default_de: There is a <style='highlight'>hole</style> in the level floor here.
exploration.sector_status_passage_prebuilt_default_d: There is an old <style='highlight'>staircase</style> {direction} here that is in a good shape and can be used.
exploration.sector_status_passage_stairwell_built_de: There is a <style='highlight'>staircase</style> here, and it has been repaired.
exploration.sector_status_passage_stairwell_default_: There is a <style='highlight'>staircase</style> here, but it needs repair.
exploration.enter_level_surface_message: There is no ceiling here, the whole level is open to the elements. The sun glares down from an impossibly wide blue sky above.
exploration.enter_level_ground_message: The floor here is different - uneven, organic, continuous. There seems to be no way further down. There are plants, mud, stone and signs of animal life.
exploration.enter_level_15_message: Only now you notice the lack of scents here, away from the Ground with its dirt and leaves. It feels barren.
exploration.enter_level_escape_message: One more level down. One more step towards freedom.
exploration.enter_level_default_message: The streets are indifferent to your presence.

log.tutorial_built_barracks_message: Built a barracks. we can now recruit soldiers to defend the camp.
log.tutorial_built_beacon_message: Beacon is ready. Its pale light paints the surroundings in sharp and fixed lines.
log.tutorial_built_bucket_message: Built a bucket. It will collect water.
log.tutorial_built_campfire_message: Built a campfire. it is a welcome respite from the darkness.
log.tutorial_built_cement_mill_message: Built a cement mill for making concrete.
log.tutorial_built_darkfarm_message: Built a snail farm. it will produce food.
log.tutorial_built_garden_message: Built a moss garden. it is a soothing place amid the jagged metal edges of the city.
log.tutorial_built_generator_message: Set up a generator. It will make life in the camp more comfortable.
log.tutorial_built_house2_message: Repaired an old tower block. It can house several households.
log.tutorial_built_inn_message: Built an inn. maybe it will attract visitors.
log.tutorial_built_research_center_message: Built a research center, rivaling those old ones built by the surfacers.
log.tutorial_built_robot_factory_message: robot factory is ready for workers.
log.tutorial_built_shrine_message: Built a shrine to the strange powers of the earth.
log.tutorial_built_square_message: Built a square. the camp feels more like a town within the city already.
log.tutorial_built_stable_message: Built a caravan stable. We can now send out traders of our own.
log.tutorial_built_temple_message: Built a temple. here, people can explore this new religion together.
log.tutorial_built_tradepost_1_message: the trading post is ready, but we need to build another one to trade with.
log.tutorial_built_tradepost_2_message: Built a trading post. our two camps now share resources and storage.
log.tutorial_built_trap_message: Built a trap. It will catch food.
log.tutorial_can_build_shrine_message: We can now build shrines to the spirits
log.tutorial_can_build_temple_message: We now have enough materials to build a temple
log.tutorial_can_make_light_message: Collected enough metal to craft a lantern
log.tutorial_encounter_blocker_type_debris_m: There is too much debris blocking the path. workers from the camp can clear it.
log.tutorial_encounter_blocker_type_explosiv: There are explosives from an old war here, blocking the way. workers from the camp can clear them.
log.tutorial_encounter_blocker_type_gang_mes: There are some pests blocking the way.
log.tutorial_encounter_blocker_type_gap_has_: There is a huge gap here, but workers from the camp can bridge it.
log.tutorial_encounter_blocker_type_gap_no_t: There is a huge gap here. need to figure out how to bridge it.
log.tutorial_encounter_blocker_type_toll_gat: There is a toll gate here guarded by gangsters. you will have to negotiate to pass.
log.tutorial_encounter_blocker_type_waste_ra: There is too much radiactive waste to continue, but it can be cleared.
There is too much radiactive waste to continue. need to learn more before you can clear it.
log.tutorial_encounter_blocker_type_waste_to: There is too much toxic waste to continue without cleaning it up first.
There is too much toxic waste to continue. need to figure out how to clean it up.
log.tutorial_encounter_hazard_debris_message: These streets are full of debris, making them difficult to traverse.
log.tutorial_encounter_ingredient_sector_for: Scavenging here should yield some hairpins for crafting lockpicks.
log.tutorial_encounter_ingredient_sector_mes: Seems like the kind of place where you might find some crafting ingredients.
log.tutorial_encounter_level_14_radiation_me: This area is dangerous. will require much better equipment to explore.
log.tutorial_encounter_outpost_message: There are few people living on this level. the camp will grow slower.
log.tutorial_encounter_sector_enemies_messag: There are some hostile creatures here. scavenging is more risky.
log.tutorial_encounter_spring_message: There is a reliable source of water here.
log.tutorial_feature_unlocked_bag_message: Found a bag that allows carrying more stuff.
log.tutorial_feature_unlocked_milestones_mes: the camp is small now, but it will grow. together we can do more.
log.tutorial_feature_unlocked_move_message: Might be worthwhile to explore the surroundings.
log.tutorial_feature_unlocked_upgrades_messa: evidence and rumours can be distilled into knowledge at the campfire.
log.tutorial_found_food_message: Found some scrap metal. it could be useful for crafting.
log.tutorial_found_medicine_message: Found some medicine. rare remnants of safer times.
log.tutorial_found_robot_message: Found a working robot. this could be useful back in camp.
log.tutorial_found_rope_message: Found some rope. could be useful for building and crafting.
log.tutorial_found_silver_message: Found some silver coins. some traders accept these.
log.tutorial_produced_robot_message: Our first worker robot is ready. it will help inhabitants with their tasks.
log.tutorial_warning_first_camp_completed_me: There is nothing more we can build here now, with our current abilities. best to explore the city more.
log.send_caravan_start_message: A trade caravan heads out into the City.
log.use_library_message: Spent some time studying knowledge of old at the library.
